newsitem.title: FRANCE: Algerians to die for French visa fraud triple murder.
newsitem.headline: Algerians to die for French visa fraud triple murder.

text.p: A court in Algeria's western city of Oran has sentenced three Algerians to death for killing the partner of one of them in a French visa fraud, along with his wife and brother-in-law.
The three bodies were found "lying in a sea of blood, hacked to ribbons by knife blows," the official news agency APS said on Sunday.
Fethallah Izidi, 29, known as "Fettouh", obtained visas for Algerians seeking entry to France from Amar Bendjeddi, former chief of external relations with Orolait, a regional milk distributor.

The Algerians paid 5,000 French francs for each visa of which Bendjeddi was to pay Izidi 2,000 for introducing "clients". At the time of the murders he owed Izidi 80,000 francs which he could not pay, the court heard.
Izidi, Farid Bouabida, 29, and Benaouda Benadda, 26, went drinking on the night of the murders, then armed themselves with butcher's knives, Bouabida told the court.

Describing the scene at the victims' house, he said: "Fettouh seized Bendjeddi and knifed him several times while we 'occupied ourselves' with his wife and brother-in-law for fear they would recognise us if we were arrested.
"I made the (couple's) little girl flee because I did not want them to kill her as well."

Izidi pleaded not guilty but was told by the court president: "Bloodstains on your clothes belong to the group of the victims...and statements of your accomplices are irrefutable proofs that you were one of the authors of this odious crime."
Executions in Algeria are normally carried out by firing squad. The three have eight days in which to appeal.
